intro: Tillandsia arpocalyx, commonly known as the pink-tipped air plant, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant is native to Brazil and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of trichomes. These trichomes help the plant absorb moisture and nutrients from the air. It produces striking pink or red flowers that bloom from the center of the rosette.
